items.title: “The Power of Tree-Based Models for Tabular Data”
items.author: Daniel Cheung
items.description:
The Tabular Data Learning Puzzle: Piecing Together the Superiority of Tree-Based Models”

Ref: Grinsztajn, L., Oyallon, E., & Varoquaux, G. (2021). Why do tree-based models still outperform deep learning on tabular data? Retrieved from https://arxiv.org/abs/2207.08815

Are you struggling with building Neural Networks for tabular data? A recent study by researchers at Inria Saclay, CNRS, and Sorbonne University found that tree-based models like XGBoost and Random Forests outperform deep learning models on tabular data. The study compared different deep learning methods with tree-based models across 45 datasets and hyperparameter combinations. The results showed that tree-based models remain state-of-the-art on medium-sized data, even without accounting for their superior speed. The researchers found that building NNs for tabular data is challenging. The study provides a benchmark for learning tabular data and data for baselines, letting researchers test new algorithms cheaply, with a fixed hyperparameter optimization budget.

Tree-based models continue to outperform deep learning models on tabular data, according to a recent study by researchers at Inria Saclay, CNRS, and Sorbonne University. The study compared standard and novel deep learning methods with tree-based models such as XGBoost and Random Forests across 45 datasets and hyperparameter combinations. The results showed that tree-based models remain state-of-the-art on medium-sized data, even without accounting for their superior speed. The researchers conducted an empirical investigation into the differing inductive biases of tree-based models and Neural Networks (NNs), which led to a series of challenges for researchers aiming to build tabular-specific NNs. These challenges include being robust to uninformative features, preserving the orientation of the data, and being able to easily learn irregular functions. The study provides a benchmark for tabular data learning and raw data for baselines, enabling researchers to cheaply test new algorithms for a fixed hyperparameter optimization budget.

The findings of this study have important implications for the machine learning community, especially for those working on tabular data. While deep learning has enabled tremendous progress on text and image datasets, its superiority on tabular data has been contested for some time. This study provides further evidence that tree-based models are still the go-to tool for most practitioners and data science competitions.

One possible reason why tree-based models outperform deep learning models on tabular data is that they have different inductive biases. Tree-based models are good at handling uninformative features, preserving the orientation of the data, and learning irregular patterns of the target function. On the other hand, NNs struggle with these challenges. Researchers aiming to build tabular-specific NNs should take these challenges into account and try to come up with solutions that address them.

To sum up, this study highlights that tree-based models still outperform deep learning models on tabular data. Moreover, their empirical investigation into the differing inductive biases of tree-based models and Neural Networks (NNs) leads to a series of challenges for researchers aiming to build tabular-specific NNs. By providing a benchmark for tabular data learning and raw data for baselines, the study helps to establish a standard for tabular data learning and to reduce unreplicability across machine learning.

items.title: “Why GitHub Pages Is the Perfect Choice for Your Portfolio Website”
items.author: Daniel Cheung
items.description:
Why GitHub Pages is the best choice for hosting your portfolio website

Abstract:

The article discusses the advantages and drawbacks of using GitHub Pages versus web hosting on Hostinger for a portfolio website. It compares the estimated fees for each option and highlights the importance of maintaining a domain name for branding and credibility purposes. The author shares their personal experience of migrating their portfolio website to GitHub Pages and the benefits they encountered, such as the availability of professional templates, easy customization options, and the opportunity to learn modern web development practices. They recommend GitHub Pages for anyone looking to create a portfolio website or personal blog, regardless of their level of experience in web development.

Why GitHub Pages Is the Perfect Choice for Your Portfolio Website 🔖

When it comes to hosting a portfolio website, there are different options available. Two of the most popular ones are GitHub Pages and web hosting on Hostinger. Here’s a comparison of the advantages, drawbacks, and estimated fees for a year for each option:

GitHub Pages 😺

Advantages

  • It’s free and easy to set up
  • GitHub Pages is best suited for static websites, like blogs and portfolios
  • It allows you to host unlimited websites for free
  • It’s powered by GitHub, which means you can leverage version control and collaborate with others easily

Drawbacks

  • Limited functionalities, as it’s best suited for static websites only
  • No support for server-side scripting languages, like PHP
  • No database support, which means you cannot use a CMS like WordPress

Estimated Fees

  • Free

Web Hosting on Hostinger 🌐

Advantages

  • Hostinger offers affordable shared hosting plans that start at just $0.99/month
  • It provides support for CMSs like WordPress and Joomla

Drawbacks

  • Limited storage and bandwidth on the cheaper plans
  • The control panel can be confusing for beginners
  • Hostinger’s customer support is not as good as other hosting providers

Estimated Fees

  • The cheapest shared hosting plan starts at $0.99/month, which amounts to $11.88 for a year. However, the more advanced plans can cost up to $15/month or more.

Migrating to GitHub Pages ⏩

After using traditional web hosting for a year, I decided to migrate my portfolio website to GitHub Pages. While web hosting on Hostinger provided quick and easy templates, I found myself limited in terms of my website’s functionality and customization options. As I lacked skills in developing websites with most web development frameworks, such as React, I found GitHub Pages to be the better option.

GitHub Pages is a free and easy-to-use hosting service that allows you to host your website directly from your GitHub repository. It provides a great learning opportunity to increase experience in deployment, as you get to learn how to use version control, collaborate with others easily, and work with modern web development practices.

One of the best things about GitHub Pages is that it offers many online templates, including professional templates that are suitable for a portfolio website. These templates provide an excellent starting point for beginners who are looking to build their website quickly and efficiently. You can then customize the template to suit your needs and preferences.

When I first started using GitHub Pages, I was pleasantly surprised by how easy it was to use. All I had to do was create a new repository, add a README file, and then create a new branch called “gh-pages.” I then added my HTML, CSS, and JavaScript files to this branch, and my website was up and running in no time.

Since migrating my website to GitHub Pages, I’ve been able to experiment with different templates and customize my website to suit my brand. I’ve also been able to make changes to my website quickly and easily using GitHub’s version control system. Additionally, I’ve learned how to use modern web development practices like responsive design and web accessibility.

In summary, I migrated my portfolio website to GitHub Pages because it provides a great learning opportunity and has professional templates available. However, I still maintain my domain, danielcheung.tech, for branding and credibility purposes. A domain name allows you to create a distinct brand identity for your portfolio website and instills trust and credibility in your visitors. It demonstrates that you have invested time and effort into establishing an online presence and showcases your commitment to your work.

If you’re looking to create a portfolio website or a personal blog, I highly recommend giving GitHub Pages a try. It’s free, easy to use, and provides a great learning opportunity for beginners. Whether you’re a seasoned web developer or a complete beginner, GitHub Pages has something to offer everyone.

Read it on Notion: https://www.notion.so/Why-GitHub-Pages-Is-the-Perfect-Choice-for-Your-Portfolio-Website-bca87393eb5a430f8edf40174efdacf5

items.title: “Will ChatGPT Replace Teachers and Psychologists? A Discussion.”
items.author: Daniel Cheung
items.description:
“ChatGPT: Will AI Replace Teachers and Psychologists?”

Abstract:

This article is an announcement for a discussion panel on the topic of ChatGPT, an AI tool that has made knowledge and creativity more accessible. The panelists will explore whether ChatGPT will replace professions like teachers, designers, and psychologists. The document includes a list of topics to be discussed, a link to watch the video, and a poll for readers to express their opinions on the topic. Additionally, there is a brief blurb about a new song inspired by ChatGPT and the impact of AI on professions.

ChatGPT, a revolutionary AI tool, has made knowledge and creativity more accessible than ever before. But what does this mean for professions like teachers, designers, and psychologists? Will AI ultimately replace these jobs that rely on human touch? In this discussion panel, we explore the potential impact of ChatGPT on various professions.

I will provide insights into ChatGPT’s algorithm and its potential applications in psychology. Topics to be discussed include:

  • How ChatGPT’s answer is calculated
  • Whether ChatGPT’s designers know what answer it will ultimately output
  • The strength of ChatGPT’s short-term memory
  • Whether AI can make judgments based on emotions
  • Which professions are difficult for AI to replace Don’t miss out on this thought-provoking discussion!
  • The article includes a list of topics to be discussed, a link to watch the video, and a poll for readers to express their opinions on the topic. Additionally, there is a brief blurb about a new song inspired by ChatGPT and the impact of AI on professions.

Read it on Notion: https://www.notion.so/Rapid-psychology-1-5e1850a1643440b4a48016a72e161616
